snippet: Leaders of the pro-democracy demonstrations in Hong Kong deny assertions that foreign governments are involved in their movement.
abstract: Chinese officials, in public and in private, have been quick to portray pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong as the latest in a series of Western-sponsored revolutions; they have seized on any hint that the demonstrators might be inspired by foreign powers, especially the United States and to a lesser extent Britain, to make their case.

byline.contributor: Chris Buckley, Hilda Wang and Alan Wong contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Leaders of the pro-democracy demonstrations in Hong Kong deny assertions that foreign governments are involved in their movement.

headline.main: Some Chinese Leaders Claim U.S. and Britain Are Behind Hong Kong Protests
headline.print_headline: Some Chinese Leaders Claim U.S. and Britain Are Behind Hong Kong Protests
